html: Warning! Spammers are changing caller-IDs to say Social Security is calling! Never give out your SSN & remember govt employees will never promise a benefit approval/increase, or threaten termination of benefits in exchange for info. In those cases, the call's fraudulent, hang up!pic.twitter.com/0eEP0JCcUg
text: Warning! Spammers are changing caller-IDs to say Social Security is calling! Never give out your SSN & remember govt employees will never promise a benefit approval/increase, or threaten termination of benefits in exchange for info. In those cases, the call's fraudulent, hang up!pic.twitter.com/0eEP0JCcUg

html: For 2/3 of seniors, Social Security is 90% of their income and the last 1/3 completely rely on the program alone! I took to the floor to ask my Republican colleagues where their courage was to do what is right for average Americans who rely on the insurance that they paid into!pic.twitter.com/ySJZC2PU16
text:
For 2/3 of seniors, Social Security is 90% of their income and the last 1/3 completely rely on the program alone!

I took to the floor to ask my Republican colleagues where their courage was to do what is right for average Americans who rely on the insurance that they paid into!pic.twitter.com/ySJZC2PU16

html: I call on my colleagues – regardless of party – do what is right. Reject calls to gut Social Security and Medicare – Do not devastate Social Security and Medicare at a time when our Baby Boomers will depend on them the most.
text: I call on my colleagues – regardless of party – do what is right. Reject calls to gut Social Security and Medicare – Do not devastate Social Security and Medicare at a time when our Baby Boomers will depend on them the most.

html: It is the insurance that working Americans have paid for and earned through a lifetime of work – and should be able to depend upon once they retire.
text: It is the insurance that working Americans have paid for and earned through a lifetime of work – and should be able to depend upon once they retire.

html: The trillions they are adding to the deficit are no accident: cutting Social Security and Medicare have always been the next step – what they call “entitlement reform”. NEWSFLASH!! These are NOT “entitlements”!
text:
The trillions they are adding to the deficit are no accident: cutting Social Security and Medicare have always been the next step – what they call “entitlement reform”. 

NEWSFLASH!!  

These are NOT “entitlements”!

html: That is why I call on the House to support my motion: To ensure that nothing in this bill can take effect unless and until the Chief Actuaries have certified that this bill will not harm the Medicare and Social Security Trust Funds.

To ensure that nothing in this bill can take effect unless and until the Chief Actuaries have certified that this bill will not harm the Medicare and Social Security Trust Funds.

html: Social Security is NOT an entitlement, it's the insurance that workers have earned and paid for with every paycheck. That's why we reject calls to privatize Social Security, cut benefits, or raise the retirement age.
text: Social Security is NOT an entitlement, it's the insurance that workers have earned and paid for with every paycheck. That's why we reject calls to privatize Social Security, cut benefits, or raise the retirement age.

html: 2 million people will have their access to food threatened if the @HouseGOP passes their hyper-partisan #FarmBill. That’s beyond unjust. We should strengthen and #ProtectSNAP — the most effective anti-hunger program in US history — not put Americans at risk of going hungry.
text:
2 million people will have their access to food threatened if the @HouseGOP passes their hyper-partisan #FarmBill.

That’s beyond unjust.

We should strengthen and #ProtectSNAP — the most effective anti-hunger program in US history — not put Americans at risk of going hungry.

html: It’s simple. There shouldn’t be a gender wage gap. Women still only make 80¢ for every $ a man is paid & that gap is even larger for women of color. That is unacceptable. I am proud to co-sponsor the Paycheck Fairness Act and will continue to fight for #EqualPay! #EqualPayDaypic.twitter.com/JoR2Zzbkvd
text: It’s simple. There shouldn’t be a gender wage gap. Women still only make 80¢ for every $ a man is paid & that gap is even larger for women of color. That is unacceptable. I am proud to co-sponsor the Paycheck Fairness Act and will continue to fight for #EqualPay! #EqualPayDaypic.twitter.com/JoR2Zzbkvd

html: Opioids are ravaging our communities. In the spending deal, we were able to secure a $3 billion increase to fight this epidemic. This is a step forward but more is needed to battle this crisis. I've heard from families affected by this awful disease. I'll cont to fight for them.
text: Opioids are ravaging our communities. In the spending deal, we were able to secure a $3 billion increase to fight this epidemic. This is a step forward but more is needed to battle this crisis. I've heard from families affected by this awful disease. I'll cont to fight for them.

html: I want to send my condolences to the family, friends and first responder community of State Trooper Kevin Miller who died today in a road accident. A stark reminder of the constant risks these brave few face everyday. Thank you for your service.

html: 4/6 The time is now. Every year we wait to address our infrastructure needs the problem grows larger. Failure to act will result in a $3.9 trillion losses to the U.S. GDP, $7 trillion in business losses, & $2.5 million lost in American jobs by 2025.https://www.infrastructurereportcard.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/ASCE-Failure-to-Act-2016-FINAL.pdf …

html: I’m inspired to see such a turnout in American cities by women demanding equal & respectful treatment. We are marching closer to a more inclusive future. There’s still work to be done - like last year & what we saw today, these voices will not be silenced! #WomensMarch2018
text:
I’m inspired to see such a turnout in American cities by women demanding equal & respectful treatment. We are marching closer to a more inclusive future. 

There’s still work to be done - like last year & what we saw today, these voices will not be silenced! #WomensMarch2018

html: The American ppl deserve better from Congress. Americans deserve to see where their elected officials stand on each of the issues separately, & deserve an up/down vote. I hope in the coming days we vote on CHIP & DACA on their own, on their merits, & take the politics out.
text: The American ppl deserve better from Congress. Americans deserve to see where their elected officials stand on each of the issues separately, & deserve an up/down vote. I hope in the coming days we vote on CHIP & DACA on their own, on their merits, & take the politics out.

html: Republicans control the House, Senate, & White House, yet they could not fulfill the most basic of function of governance – keeping the federal govt open. We’ve gone from stopgap to stopgap w/o any meaningful attempt from Rs to work bipartisanly on a long term budget agreement.
text: Republicans control the House, Senate, & White House, yet they could not fulfill the most basic of function of governance – keeping the federal govt open.  We’ve gone from stopgap to stopgap w/o any meaningful attempt from Rs to work bipartisanly on a long term budget agreement.

html: The American people sent us to Congress to work on solutions, but once again we are kicking the can down the road in a failure to govern. It’s our responsibility to vote on these issues and we should take them up one by one so the American people see where we stand. (2/2)
text: The American people sent us to Congress to work on solutions, but once again we are kicking the can down the road in a failure to govern. It’s our responsibility to vote on these issues and we should take them up one by one so the American people see where we stand. (2/2)

html: I could not support today’s CR bc it was another missed opportunity for #DACA, the opioid crisis, disaster relief to PR/USVI, and more. While there was funding for #CHIP, we should never play politics with children’s health.(1/2)

html: I am reminded of one of his most succinct quotes. "The time is always right to do what is right”, and his famous call for the “fierce urgency of now”.
